SEARCH

Uses of Package
arcs

Packages that use arcs
Package
Description
arcs
Provides the different types of Arcs that are present in the PetriNet Content: - ArcPT An Arc exiting from a Place and entering into a Transition - ArcTP An Arc exiting from a Transition and entering into a Place - ArcDrain An ArcPT which when fired drains all tokens from its Place - ArcZero An ArcPT which can only be fired when its Place has no tokens
interfaces
Provides the different interfaces Content : - IPetriNet Interface for a PetriNet, outlining methods for adding,removing, and retrieving places, transitions, and arcs within the net.
main
Provides main building blocks of the PetriNet : Content - Arc - Place - Transition - PetriNet
  • Classes in arcs used by arcs
    Class
    Description
    ArcPT
    ArcPT models an arc that goes from a Place to a Transition (Arc Place to Transition).
  • Classes in arcs used by interfaces
    Class
    Description
    ArcDrain
    ArcDrain is a specialized ArcPT that removes all tokens from the connected Place when the transition fires.
    ArcPT
    ArcPT models an arc that goes from a Place to a Transition (Arc Place to Transition).
    ArcTP
    ArcTP models an arc that goes from a Transition to a Place (Arc Transition to Place).
    ArcZero
    ArcZero is a specialized ArcPT that fires only when the connected Place has zero tokens.
  • Classes in arcs used by main
    Class
    Description
    ArcDrain
    ArcDrain is a specialized ArcPT that removes all tokens from the connected Place when the transition fires.
    ArcPT
    ArcPT models an arc that goes from a Place to a Transition (Arc Place to Transition).
    ArcTP
    ArcTP models an arc that goes from a Transition to a Place (Arc Transition to Place).
    ArcZero
    ArcZero is a specialized ArcPT that fires only when the connected Place has zero tokens.
